intro: Matthiola paniculata, commonly known as the annual stock, is an herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, producing clusters of fragrant, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. Matthiola paniculata is cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
